PageTitle: peer filter-policy export (BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view) (group)
FuncDef:
The peer filter-policy export command configures an ACL-based policy for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer group.
The undo peer filter-policy export command cancels this configuration. The peer filter-policy export command configures an ACL-based policy for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer group. The undo peer filter-policy export command cancels this configuration. By default, no filtering policy is configured for the routes to be advertised to a peer group. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view,BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv6 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a peer group.
The name is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the number of the basic ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the name of a basic named ACL6.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The value must start with a letter (a to z or A to Z, case sensitive).

ExtraInfo: If you do not want all routes to be advertised to a peer group, you can run the peer filter-policy export command to configure an ACL-based filtering policy to filter the routes to be advertised to the peer group.
